alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 07 at 3:08PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STORM FORCE LOWS FOR WEDNESDAY AND FRIDAY... A strong low over the Gulf of Alaska will bring a storm force front to the panhandle tomorrow. This system will bring increased winds along the outer coast. Wind gusts could range from 45 to 55 mph. Forecast guidance today continues to show a strong front impacting the area Wednesday morning to Thursday morning. As such, confidence in this system continues to increase. Most places look to see their strongest winds during afternoon and into the overnight hours Wednesday into Thursday. Winds behind the front are expected to decrease after the front moves through but post frontal winds are expected to be 20 to 30 mph before further decreasing on Thursday. River rises are expected with this first system moving through as temperatures are expected to warm. Snow levels are also expected to rise with the warming temperatures so some snow melting will be likely during this event. River flooding is not expected at this time as rivers are running lower due to the colder temperatures allowing precipitation to fall as snow at elevation. After the storm exits the area on Thursday, we will see a brief break for Southeast Alaska before another system moves into the during the overnight hours Thursday night into the morning on Friday. Forecast guidance for this second system continues to show strong winds along the front moving across the panhandle through the day on Friday starting during the morning hours. Right now, winds are expected to be 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. This is an evolving and changing situation. Stay tuned to the National Weather Service for updates at weather.gov/Juneau.
